content: glossary diamond in the ruff ssk slip slip knit slip next two stitches one at a time knitwise to the right needle insert the left needle into the front legs of those sts and knit them together k2tog knit 2 stitches together m1 make one stitch by inserting the left hand needle from front to back under the strand between the last stitch worked and the next stitch on the needle knit into the back loop of this stitch to make one pm place marker rc right cross- skip 1 stitch k1 purl the skipped stitch slide both off left hand needle lc left cross- slip 1 stitch to cable needle and hold in front p1 k1 from the cable needle or don t use a cable needle skip 1 stitch p1 gently slide both stitches off the left hand needle and use your fingers to free the skipped stitch and knit it i find this easier than using a cable needle for a single left cross tabby modeling the sweater above in size small diamond panel right side row shown wrong side weighs 12 5 pounds has a 17 5 inch chest and from the row knit stitches as presented knit the knits and purl base of her neck to her tail she measures 14 inches the purls materials row  plymouth yarn encore worsted tweed color 1 p6 rc p1 rc 2x lc 2x p1 lc p6 # 5598 blue 1 1 2 2 skeins 3 p5 rc p1 rc 2x p2 lc 2x p1 lc p5  size 7 4 5mm circular needles and dpns or size 5 p4 rc p1 rc 2x p4 lc 2x p1 lc p4 needed to obtain gauge 7 p3 rc p1 rc 2x p6 lc 2x p1 lc p3  stitch markers 9 p2 rc p1 rc 2x p8 lc 2x p1 lc p2  cable needle optional 11 p2 lc p1 lc 2x p8 rc 2x p1 rc p2  yarn needle for finishing 13 p3 lc p1 lc 2x p6 rc 2x p1 rc p3 finished measurements 15 p4 lc p1 lc 2x p4 rc 2x p1 rc p4 17 p5 lc p1 lc 2x p2 rc 2x p1 rc p5 extra small 14 5 inch chest 11 inch back 19 p6 lc p1 lc 2x rc 2x p1 rc p6 small 20 5 inch chest 14 inch back medium 24 5 inch chest 18 inch back large 29 inch chest 21 inch back notes sweater is knit flat from the top down gauge 19 stitches and 26 row to 4 inches over stocking stitch instructions are for size extra small with small medium and large sizes in parenthesis pattern cast on 50 66 74 86 sts back shaping work neck ribbing ws k1 p1 6 10 12 15 times bind off 8 18 23 29 sts at beginning of next two row pm k1 p1 4 times k2 p1 k1 p2 k1 p1 k2 p1 k1 4 next
